Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 19 hours ago, RoverDude said:
> 
> 
> 'Back of the envelope' extended hab and life support numbers based on Colony Supplies / Fertilizer.  These stats assume the use of **the standard <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> balance figures and adequate converter capacity**.  
> 
> Removed hard-coded time values
> 

What does that mean exactly?  

Does it assume - based on available Fertilizer - that all Mulch gets converted into Supplies at as fast as crew consuming them, i.e. without checking the actually available converters?

related q  

what happens if mulch+ Fertilizer => Supplies  is not inaf to feed the crew?  

crew is using Supplies but acts as if dont have any / dont use Supplies until thers inaf / use Supplies and is ok whit it?

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, KerbMav said:
> 
> 
> What does that mean exactly?  
> 
> Does it assume - based on available Fertilizer - that all Mulch gets converted into Supplies at as fast as crew consuming them, i.e. without checking the actually available converters?
> 

It just means that it assumes that 1 fertilizer will eventually become 10 supplies.  This is informational only for use in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> to help people do some of the math we've normally just done in our heads.

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, danielboro said:
> 
> 
> related q  
> 
> what happens if mulch+ Fertilizer => Supplies  is not inaf to feed the crew?  
> 
> crew is using Supplies but acts as if dont have any / dont use Supplies until thers inaf / use Supplies and is ok whit it?
> 

If there are no supplies... the crew starves.  No change on that front.

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, RoverDude said:
> 
> 
> If there are no supplies... the crew starves.  No change on that front.
> 

hopefully not for very long, as there supplies are being produced(although if some of the kerbals are greedy and do not share, I could see some going tourist while others are perfectly happy)

I recently installed this mod, only to find out that one kerbal consumes 43.2kg of supply per earth day. How is that possible.

I just think it's reaaaaaaaaally difficult to perform a manned mission in a real-scaled system with <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS installed.

And of course the colonization part

> 
> 
> 28 minutes ago, Iso-Polaris said:
> 
> 
> I recently installed this mod, only to find out that one kerbal consumes 43.2kg of supply per earth day. How is that possible.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I just think it's reaaaaaaaaally difficult to perform a manned mission in a real-scaled system with <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS installed.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> And of course the colonization part
> 

it has been explained before. And possibly on the wiki. Keep in mind "supplies" are far more than "food"

[https://github.com/UmbraSpaceIndustries/<abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS/wiki/FAQ](https://github.com/UmbraSpaceIndustries/USI-LS/wiki/FAQ)

**Edited <time datetime="2017-08-18T01:10:58Z" title="08/18/2017 01:10  AM" data-short="6 yr">August 18, 2017</time> by goldenpsp**

Most of supplies are water - for drinking, hygeine, etc. 

If you're scaling everything up, feel free to alter values accordingly.  They were designed for a six hour Kerbal day.  Also... use recyclers.  Or your life is going to be REALLY hard.

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, goldenpsp said:
> 
> 
> it has been explained before. And possibly on the wiki. Keep in mind "supplies" are far more than "food"
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [https://github.com/UmbraSpaceIndustries/<abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS/wiki/FAQ](https://github.com/UmbraSpaceIndustries/USI-LS/wiki/FAQ)
> 

Still too much for a oversized system, I change it in setting but no effect

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Iso-Polaris said:
> 
> 
> Still too much for a oversized system, I change it in setting but no effect
> 

The settings cfg is what new saves start with.

To change your current game's settings, open the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS options in the space center view.

> 
> 
> 11 hours ago, Iso-Polaris said:
> 
> 
> Still too much for a oversized system, I change it in setting but no effect
> 

Obvious question.  Are you using recyclers?

> 
> 
> 19 hours ago, Iso-Polaris said:
> 
> 
> I just think it's reaaaaaaaaally difficult to perform a manned mission in a real-scaled system with <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS installed.
> 

Well, yes. Look at the paucity of manned missions beyond low orbit in the other real-scaled system that we all know. For what it's worth, I think mounting a manned mission in upscale <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS/MKS is still considerably easier than a fully-realistic simulation would be - no breakdowns, know which spares will be needed, know in advance the performance of your equipment on worlds you haven't visited yet - and I don't normally mod the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS settings beyond swapping capsule monopropellant for the equivalent mass of supplies.

I encountered a minor issue with this wonderful mod. 

The part "Viewing Cupola" has a crew capacity of 1 but doesn't have a hatch. Does anyone know of a way to stop the game from using this part when generating rescue missions?

doing a rendezvous with a stranded Kerbal just to find him unable to go EVA always makes me sad. 

**Edited <time datetime="2017-08-31T10:25:24Z" title="08/31/2017 10:25  AM" data-short="6 yr">August 31, 2017</time> by Physics Student**

> <iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/141560-130-ksp-rescue-pod-validator-no-more-kerbals-spawning-in-inflatable-modules/&do=embed"></iframe>

[@RoverDude](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/105198-roverdude/), would you consider adding a link to and brief mention of the rescue pod validator to the <abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr>? Not everyone will see it, but some will. It might even get some people to install it BEFORE they run into this issue. 

[@Physics Student](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/174876-physics-student/)

Be advised that the rescue pod validator won't change the pods from any existing contracts (I think that includes contracts that are offered but not yet accepted) but will stop bad contracts from generating going forward.
[@Merkov](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/165068-merkov/) - sure ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Anyone other than me having the problem, that the Supplies calculation in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> is wrong as soon as one adds a Kerbitat and switches it to something other from recycler?

So, MK1-2 Pod, 2,5m Life Supply Tank => 138d for 3 kerbals.

Now add a 2,5m Kerbitat => 1y 304d,

Now switch the Kerbitat to Hab Common => It stays at 1y 304d.

<abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS version is 0.6.2.0.

Quick question.  It was mentioned here couple weeks ago, that kerbals who became tourists are immune to starvation/EC loss. Is this still the case or am I doing something wrong ? If it is, is there a way to change that ?

Thank you very much.

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, JimRex said:
> 
> 
> Quick question.  It was mentioned here couple weeks ago, that kerbals who became tourists are immune to starvation/EC loss. Is this still the case or am I doing something wrong ? If it is, is there a way to change that ?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Thank you very much.
> 

I'm not sure I understand the question.  Yes one of the settings is that the "punishment" for loss of lifesupport is turning into Tourists.  Therefore tourists are the result of starvation or EC loss.  It wouldn't make sense for them to also be affected by starvation or EC loss.

You can change the setting to death instead.

> 
> 
> 51 minutes ago, goldenpsp said:
> 
> 
> I'm not sure I understand the question.  Yes one of the settings is that the "punishment" for loss of lifesupport is turning into Tourists.  Therefore tourists are the result of starvation or EC loss.  It wouldn't make sense for them to also be affected by starvation or EC loss.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> You can change the setting to death instead.
> 

Imagine this situation: you Kerbals go on a strike because of homesickness, they transform into tourists. Your ship runs out of supplies. Kerbal toursits don't die of starvation/EC loss even after 15 days,... even after a year.

You can now return to Kerbin or a resupply station and turn them back to normal without any repercussions.

Settings used:

-NoHomeEffect - Grouchy

-Death on anything else

> 
> 
> 42 minutes ago, JimRex said:
> 
> 
> Imagine this situation: you Kerbals go on a strike because of homesickness, they transform into tourists. Your ship runs out of supplies. Kerbal toursits don't die of starvation/EC loss even after 15 days,... even after a year.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> You can now return to Kerbin or a resupply station and turn them back to normal without any repercussions.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Settings used:
> 
> 
> 
> 
> -NoHomeEffect - Grouchy
> 
> 
> 
> 
> -Death on anything else
> 

Yep, that's probably not a combination of issues that was originally considered.

I've been looking at TAC LS and <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS for a bit now.I tried TAC LS , but it feels too easy and overall pretty simple (since it doesn't take into account mental health and other more complex stuff) , so I decided to try <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS with the Kolonization expansion (since I still want to colonize Mars).I have two questions : Is there a in-depth tutorial (possibly not outdated) and is this mod calibrated for a 24 hrs day (<abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr>/<abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr>)?

> 
> 
> 5 hours ago, Mr. Sandman said:
> 
> 
> Is there a in-depth tutorial (possibly not outdated) and is this mod calibrated for a 24 hrs day (<abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr>/<abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr>)?
> 

<abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> mods have been changing fairly often of late.  There is a wiki at [https://github.com/UmbraSpaceIndustries/MKS/wiki.](https://github.com/UmbraSpaceIndustries/MKS/wiki)  I can't comment authoritatively on its currency although I believe it's close.  Stock MKS is calibrated for 6 hr days.  I don't know if there's a patch for <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr>/<abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr>,.

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, Brigadier said:
> 
> 
> <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> mods have been changing fairly often of late.  There is a wiki at [https://github.com/UmbraSpaceIndustries/MKS/wiki.](https://github.com/UmbraSpaceIndustries/MKS/wiki)  I can't comment authoritatively on its currency although I believe it's close.  Stock MKS is calibrated for 6 hr days.  I don't know if there's a patch for <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr>/<abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr>,.
> 

You are right about the stock calibration, but all settings are reachable from the settings screen at the space center. You can just divide/multiply the necessary settings by four easily enough -- no patch needed.

At least that is how I have done it in my <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> game.

> 
> 
> 7 hours ago, Mandella said:
> 
> 
> You are right about the stock calibration, but all settings are reachable from the settings screen at the space center. You can just divide/multiply the necessary settings by four easily enough -- no patch needed.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> At least that is how I have done it in my <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> game.
> 

Yeah because I noticed my Kerbals were using enormous quantities of food for a  500 days trip (well they are big anyways , but I needed enormous containers)Thank for the tip , I'll try the x4 thing.
